action.action-desc: Mr. Morelle (for himself and Mr. Ellzey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of Transportation to extend the duration of certain waivers for school bus drivers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Get Our Kids to School Act of 2022.

subsection.text: In the case of a covered waiver, the period specified in section 31315(a)(1) of title 49, United States Code, shall be treated as a period not in excess of 1 year.

subsection.header: Public comments on further extension of waiver
subsection.text: Not later than 120 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall solicit public comments on the feasibility and potential benefits of granting a covered waiver of unlimited duration.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, funds made available to a State under section 31313 of title 49, United States Code, may be used by the State to assist with costs associated with a covered waiver.

In this section, the term covered waiver means a waiver that grants to States the discretion to waive the engine compartment component of the pre-trip vehicle inspection skills requirement described in section 383.113(a)(1)(i) of title 49, Code of Federal Regulations, for a commercial driverâ€™s license applicant seeking to operate a school bus.
